How to contribute: Micro Quickstart Guide

  1. Create a Github Account (if you don't have one already) https://help.github.com/articles/signing-up-for-a-new-github-account/
  2. (optional) Chat with someone in the project in real-time (or as close to it as possible) via our public rooms on Gitter. https://gitter.im/Peeragogy
  3. (optional) Create a Hypothes.is account if you would like to make in-line comments on the online version of the book. https://hypothes.is/
  4. (optional) Connect with +Peeragogy Project on Google+ and join our live discussions, usually taking place weekly (and archived on YouTube).
  5. Start editing, discussing, and commenting.
Please have a look at this longer quickstart guide for more information.

How to cite

J. Corneli, C. J. Danoff, C. Pierce, P. Ricuarte, and L. Snow MacDonald, eds. The Peeragogy Handbook. 3rd ed. Chicago, IL./Somerville, MA.: PubDomEd/Pierce Press, 2016. Downloaded from http://peeragogy.org.

Or in BibTeX: 
@book{peeragogy-handbook,
 title={{P}eeragogy {H}andbook},
 editor={Corneli, Joseph and Danoff, Charles Jeffrey and Pierce, Charlotte and Ricuarte, Paola and Snow MacDonald, Lisa},
 year={2016},
 edition={3},
 address={Chicago, IL./Somerville, MA.},
 publisher={PubDomEd/Pierce Press},
 url={http://peeragogy.org},
}
